p:
Spectroscopy gives vibrational data, which are still insufficient to determine the structures of phases II, III, and IV. There have been many and varied attempts to identify the structures via simulations
20â€“ 30 . However, a consensus has not yet been reached. Based on fully ab initio calculations, including density functional theory (DFT) or quantum Monte Carlo (QMC)
31 , a number of candidate structures have been proposed for Phase II and III. Besides differing molecular orientation, they are all similar, consisting of primitive cells with lattice sites close to hcp
22 . Among the structures, the P2 1/ c-24, C2/ c-24, and P c-48 structures provide low-energy candidate structures for phases II, III, and IV.
